summary.title: Project Summary
summary.subtitle: Key information about the Dogtor project
summary.sloganText: Work smoothly, neck in good condition~

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.content:
Working for long periods while staring at screens can cause neck discomfort, and in severe cases, lead to cervical spondylosis.

This is a browser extension called Dogtor that periodically triggers website page rotation - left rotation for 30 seconds, right rotation for 30 seconds - making you subconsciously move your neck.

Work smoothly, neck in good condition~

target.title: Target Audience
target.content:
Busy office workers with cervical spine problems

Modern professionals who spend long hours at computers and are prone to neck strain and cervical spine issues due to poor posture and lack of movement.

problem.title: Problem Solved
problem.content:
Solving the problem of office workers being immersed in work, forgetting to exercise their cervical spine, and timely prevention and treatment of cervical spine diseases.

Many people develop cervical spine problems due to:
• Prolonged computer use
• Poor posture habits
• Lack of regular neck exercises
• Forgetting to take breaks during intensive work

solution.title: Technical Solution
solution.content:
Dogtor uses innovative web-based rotation technology to create a natural and non-intrusive cervical spine exercise experience:

• Automatic page rotation triggers
• Customizable rotation intervals
• Gentle visual cues for neck movement
• Seamless browser integration
• User-friendly settings and controls

features.title: Technical Features
